com.artisan.manager

Class ArtisanManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.artisan.manager.ArtisanManager

  • public class ArtisanManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Initializes Artisan and manages its lifecycle. ArtisanManager is automatically initialized when your app starts. Use ArtisanManager to connect to Artisan and automatically download all experiments, configuration, and published changes for your app.

        public void setArtisanService(com.artisan.services.ArtisanService service)

      • start

        public void start(java.lang.String appId,
         java.lang.String version)

        Start your Artisan instance.

        Use this method to start Artisan. This declaration should occur at the end of your CustomArtisanService#startArtisanManager() method. 

          public void startArtisanManager() {
  		// register your in-code experiments here
  		artisanManager.start("506adf5ed6fbbc5222000018", "1.0");
  }
        Parameters:
        appId - The Artisan ID for your app (e.g. '506adf5ed6fbbc5222000018'). This ID is available in your Artisan Tools dashboard.
        version - The Artisan version number for your app (e.g '1.0'). This corresponds with the 'Current Version' value in your Artisan Tools dashboard for this app.

      • start

public void start(java.lang.String appId,
                    java.lang.String version,
                    com.artisan.manager.ArtisanConfigOption options)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated. Instead you should use ArtisanApplication startArtisan from the onCreate of your Application class

      • onFirstPlaylistDownloaded

        public static void onFirstPlaylistDownloaded(android.app.Activity activity,
                             com.artisan.manager.ArtisanManagerCallback callback)
        Register a callback to be called when the first Artisan Playlist is downloaded from the servers after the app process is started.

        This method has no timeout, so it will wait indefinitely. This does not block the main thread, but if the device is offline or a playlist is not received for some other reason this block will never execute.

        NOTE: The thread calling the block of code is guaranteed to be the main thread. If the code inside of the block requires executing on a background thread you will need to implement this logic.

        IMPORTANT: You only get one on first playlist downloaded callback and it will only be called once per app process. So, even if you background and foreground your app the first playlist callbacks won't be called again.

         ArtisanManager.onFirstPlaylistDownloaded(this, new ArtisanManagerCallback() {
        @Override
        public void execute() {
                Toast.makeText(MainActivity.this, "Your playlist is here!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
        }
 });
 
 
        

        Parameters:
        activity - The activity which the callback is to be called on. The callback will be executed in the UI Thread from this activity.
        callback - Callback to execute when the first Artisan playlist is downloaded.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        onFirstPlaylistDownloaded
        

        public static void onFirstPlaylistDownloaded(android.app.Activity activity,
                             com.artisan.manager.ArtisanManagerCallback callback,
                             long timeInMillis)
        

        Register a callback to be called when the first Artisan Playlist is downloaded from the servers after the app process is started.
        
 
        
 If the timeout is reached before the first playlist is downloaded then the block will be executed.
        
 
        
 
 NOTE: The thread calling the block of code is guaranteed to be the main thread. If the code inside of the block requires executing on a background thread you will need to implement this logic. 
        
 
        
 IMPORTANT: You only get one on first playlist downloaded callback and it will only be called once per app process. So, even if you background and foreground your app the first playlist callbacks won't be called again.
        
 
        
 
 
         ArtisanManager.onFirstPlaylistDownloaded(this, new ArtisanManagerCallback() {
        @Override
        public void execute() {
                Toast.makeText(MainActivity.this, "Your playlist is here!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show();
  }
 }, 2000);
 
 
        

        Parameters:
        activity - The activity which the callback is to be called on. The callback will be executed in the UI Thread from this activity.
        callback - Callback to execute when the first Artisan playlist is downloaded.
        timeInMillis - How long to wait for the playlist to download. If the timeout is reached the callback will be executed even though the playlist hasn't been downloaded yet.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        isFirstPlaylistDownloaded
        

        public static boolean isFirstPlaylistDownloaded()
        

        Check if the first Artisan Playlist is downloaded from the servers since the app process is started.
        
 
        
 
 If this is true when you register your callback with onFirstPlaylistDownloaded(Activity, ArtisanManagerCallback) then your callback will execute immediately.
        

        Returns:
        True if the first playlist has already been downloaded from the Artisan Servers since this app process was first started.

        startArtisan
        

        public static void startArtisan(ArtisanRegisteredApplication application,
                java.lang.String appID)
        

        
 To use Artisan you will need to add an implementation for onCreate in your Application class and call this method after you call super.onCreate.
 
        
 
        
 This will call the registerPowerhooks, registerInCodeExperiments, and registerUserProfileVariables methods for you and get the ArtisanService ready for your application.
 
        
 
        
 Sample usage:
 
        
 
 
         @Override
 protected void onCreate() {
        super.onCreate();
        // Call Artisan AFTER super onCreate
        ArtisanApplication.artisanOnCreate(this, "YOURAPPIDHERE");
 }
 
        

        Parameters:
        application - a reference to the application that is being created
        appID - The Artisan ID for your app (e.g. '506adf5ed6fbbc5222000018'). This ID is available in your Artisan Tools dashboard.
        

        • 

      




        

      • 

        startArtisan
        

        public static void startArtisan(ArtisanRegisteredApplication application,
                java.lang.String appID,
                com.artisan.manager.ArtisanConfigOption startupConfiguration)
        

        
 To use Artisan you will need to add an implementation for onCreate in your Application class and call this method after you call super.onCreate.
 
        
 
        
 This will call the registerPowerhooks, registerInCodeExperiments and registerUserProfileVariables methods for you and get the ArtisanService ready for your application.
 
        

        Parameters:
        application - a reference to the application that is being created
        appID - The Artisan ID for your app (e.g. '506adf5ed6fbbc5222000018'). This ID is available in your Artisan Tools dashboard.
        startupConfiguration - Artisan startup configuration options. These options will override the Artisan defaults.

        setPushSenderId
        

        public static void setPushSenderId(java.lang.String pushSenderId)
        

        Provide Artisan with your Push Sender ID. This is your Google API Project Number.
 
 You get your project number when you set up a project at https://console.developers.google.com/project
        

        Parameters:
        pushSenderId -
